p: Finding viable eggs of Ae. taylori maintained in villages was not expected. Indeed, this species was almost never found biting humans within villages area [ 17, 26]. This species could feed on other animals within villages or breed in some villages close to wild environment before going back to forests and savannahs where it bites. The localized maintenance of Ae. furcifer in tree holes from forests is consistent with its oviposition behavior but discordant with the fact that it could feed in all the land covers found in the area including villages indoors [ 17].
